question: 香り
sourceMnemonic: This is the noun version of <ja>香</ja>, making it have the same meaning, <vocabulary>fragrance</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: The <vocabulary>fragrance</vocabulary> you smell is somebody's <ja><reading>顔</reading></ja> (<ja>かお</ja>). Just imagine smelling the fragrance of a bunch of people's faces. Yum!
